title: António Guterres
summary: António Manuel de Oliveira Guterres GCC GCL (/ɡʊˈtɛrəs/; European Portuguese: [ɐ̃ˈtɔnju ɡuˈtɛʁɨʃ]; born 30 April 1949)[1] is a Portuguese politician. Since 2017, he has served as the Secretary-General of the United Nations. He is the ninth person to hold the title. A member of the Portuguese Socialist Party, Guterres served as prime minister of Portugal from 1995 to 2002.
